snippet: The decision, the latest in a string of legal victories for gay rights, will not take effect immediately, and an appeal is almost certain.
abstract: Judge Terence C Kern of United States District Court for Northern District of Oklahoma rules that state's constitutional amendment barring same-sex marriage violates federal Constitution; decision, latest in string of legal victories for gay rights, will not take effect immediately, and appeal is almost certain.
lead_paragraph: The decision, the latest in a string of legal victories for gay rights, will not take effect immediately, and an appeal is almost certain.

headline.main: Oklahoma’s Ban on Gay Marriage Is Unconstitutional, Judge Rules
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma’s Ban on Gay Marriage Is Unconstitutional, Judge Rules

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
